title: From meteor shower to comet: Astronomical events to look forward to in Jan 2025 - The Times of India
summary:
Astronomical Events to Look Forward to in January 2025

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: Unknown

January 2025 brings a dazzling lineup of astronomical events that will captivate both avid sky-watchers and casual stargazers.

  • January 3: Venus and Moon conjunction visible after sunset.
  • January 3-4: Quadrantid Meteor Shower peaks with 60 to 200 meteors per hour.
  • January 4: Occultation of Saturn by the Moon observable in select locations.
  • January 4: Earth at Perihelion, closest point to the Sun.
  • January 9-10: Venus reaches its greatest elongation.
  • January 13: Wolf Moon, marking the full moon of January.
  • January 16: Mars at opposition, appearing brighter in the sky.
  • January 29: New Moon, ideal for stargazing.
"January’s full moon, known as Wolf Moon, has great cultural significance for many cultures."

In summary, this January offers numerous celestial events that provide excellent opportunities for stargazing and appreciating the wonders of our universe.
newTitle: Astronomical Events to Look Forward to in January 2025

title: Theory of relativity, quantum physics key to explaining Big Bang, says scientist - The Hindu
summary:
Theory of relativity, quantum physics key to explaining Big Bang, says scientist

Published: January 02, 2025, Source: The Hindu

A combination of Albert Einstein’s theory of relativity and quantum physics may help explain the expansion of the universe from a singular entity, according to P. Ajith, an astrophysicist with the International Centre for Theoretical Sciences in Bengaluru. He presented this topic during a lecture at the Regional Science Centre and Planetarium in Kozhikode.

  • The primordial atom theory, proposed by Georges Lemaitre, is more of a narrative than a scientific fact.
  • History of cosmic understanding spans from Copernicus to Newton, shaping modern science and technology.
  • Einstein’s theory redefined gravity as a consequence of space-time effects rather than a force.
“The primordial atom is just a way of explaining what might have happened. To understand what happened then, we need to combine Einstein’s theory of relativity with quantum physics.” - P. Ajith

The integration of these scientific principles might offer profound insights into the universe's origins and evolution, highlighting the importance of continued exploration in physics.
newTitle: Key Insights on Big Bang Explained Through Relativity and Quantum Physics

title: 'TMC Not Guarding Borders': Mamata Banerjee Says BSF Allowing Bangladeshi Infiltration, BJP Retorts - News18
Gautam Gambhir Rejected Request To Keep Rohit Sharma In Playing XI For 5th Australia Test: Report - NDTV Sports
summary:
Gautam Gambhir Rejects Request to Keep Rohit Sharma in the Playing XI for the 5th Australia Test

Date: January 25, 2025

Source: NDTV

Indian cricket team skipper Rohit Sharma is set to be rested for the fifth Test against Australia due to poor form, with reports indicating he managed only 31 runs in his last three matches of the series, while Shubman Gill is likely to replace him.

  • Rohit Sharma has faced challenges during the test series, scoring poorly.
  • An influential cricket administrator's request to retain him was turned down by Gambhir.
  • Gambhir's priority remains India's chances in the World Test Championship (WTC) final.
  • If not played, Rohit would become the first Indian captain dropped for poor performance in a Test.
  • Jasprit Bumrah might take over leadership if Rohit is sidelined.
“Performance is the only thing that would keep a player in the dressing room helmed by him.” - Gautam Gambhir

This decision highlights the emphasis on performance as India aims to compete for the WTC final. Whether Rohit plays or not may significantly impact his future in Test cricket.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Rejects Request to Keep Rohit Sharma in the Playing XI for the 5th Australia Test

title: Lalu Yadav's offer to Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for tie-up sparks buzz; Tejashwi downplays - Hindustan Times
summary:
Lalu Yadav's offer to Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for tie-up sparks buzz; Tejashwi downplays

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Political discussions in Bihar are heating up as Lalu Yadav has suggested a potential realignment with chief minister Nitish Kumar. Although Kumar downplays the suggestion, speculation regarding a fresh political alliance has emerged ahead of upcoming elections.

  • RJD leader Lalu Yadav extends an offer to Nitish Kumar to rejoin the INDIA bloc.
  • Nitish Kumar responds cryptically to media queries about the offer.
  • Tejashwi Yadav, Lalu's son, downplays his father's remarks, stating there will be no realignment.
  • Political leaders from JD(U) and BJP dismiss the idea of a realignment as unrealistic.
"In politics, everything is possible. There are no permanent friends or enemies in politics." - RJD senior leader Bhai Birendra

The political landscape in Bihar remains dynamic as parties prepare for the upcoming elections, suggesting that political alignments could shift significantly.
newTitle: Lalu Yadav Proposes Political Realignment with Nitish Kumar Amid Speculation

title: 6 Stunning Pictures Of Quasars and Black Holes Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
summary:
6 Stunning Pictures Of Quasars and Black Holes Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Jan 2, 2025 Source: Times Now

This article highlights six breathtaking images of quasars and black holes captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing the beauty and complexity of these astronomical phenomena.

  • Markarian 231: Two black holes in a close orbital dance illuminating the galaxy’s center.
  • Markarian 817: A spiral galaxy with blue star clusters surrounding an active supermassive black hole.
  • Quasar 3C 273: One of the closest quasars, its light took 2.5 billion years to reach Earth.
  • NGC 4438: A black hole exhibiting chaotic behavior with massive outflows of hot gas.
  • Quasar Tsunamis: Showcases the immense energy produced by quasars.
"Quasars produce immense energy, powered by a supermassive black hole consuming surrounding matter."

This collection of images not only illustrates the stunning visuals provided by the Hubble Space Telescope but also emphasizes the crucial role that these celestial bodies play in the universe.
newTitle: 6 Stunning Pictures Of Quasars and Black Holes Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

title: 'Covid vibes, multiple viruses spreading': Is China hiding a new epidemic? Here's what we know - Moneycontrol
summary:
Covid vibes, multiple viruses spreading: Is China hiding a new epidemic? Here's what we know

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

There are increasing concerns about multiple viruses spreading in China, reminiscent of the COVID pandemic. Videos and reports suggest that hospitals are overwhelmed and a state of health emergency may be in effect.

  • Social media posts indicate a severe flu outbreak, with significant overcrowding in hospitals.
  • Viruses reported include Influenza A, HMPV, and others, alongside COVID-19.
  • Claims of a health emergency being declared due to the rapid spread of these viruses.
"Hospitals in China are overwhelmed by a severe 'flu' outbreak, including Influenza A and HMPV, drawing comparisons to the 2020 COVID surge."

This situation highlights ongoing public health challenges in China and raises questions about the transparency of information being shared.
newTitle: China Facing Health Crisis Amid Multiple Virus Outbreaks

Mars, Venus, Saturn and Jupiter to align the night sky in January: Here's the exact date and time - India TV News
summary:
January Planet Parade: Mars, Venus, Saturn, and Jupiter Align in the Night Sky

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: India TV News

This January, stargazers and astronomers will witness a spectacular alignment of four major planets: Mars, Venus, Saturn, and Jupiter, with the best view on January 17 and 18.

  • Mars will reach its brightest point on January 15-16, sitting prominently in the constellation Gemini.
  • Venus and Saturn will appear unusually close together, separated by only a few finger widths.
  • Jupiter will complete the planetary lineup, shining brightly in the sky.
  • Uranus and Neptune will also be visible for those with telescopes.
  • This event is referred to as a 'planet parade' by astronomers, highlighting its rarity and significance.
Mars’ opposition not only offers a visual delight but also provides ideal conditions for spacecraft launches and interplanetary missions.

This alignment not only captivates observers but also holds potential significance for future space exploration endeavors.
newTitle: January Planet Parade: Mars, Venus, Saturn, and Jupiter Align in the Night Sky

title: US considers potential rules to restrict or bar Chinese drones - Reuters
summary:
US Considers Potential Rules to Restrict or Bar Chinese Drones

Date: January 2, 2024

Source: Reuters

The U.S. Commerce Department is evaluating new rules aimed at restricting or banning Chinese drones due to national security concerns, with public comments accepted until March 4.

  • The U.S. cites potential threats from Chinese and Russian manufacturers.
  • China dominates U.S. commercial drone sales.
  • Restrictions could mirror those applied to Chinese vehicles.
  • New rules are under consideration as President-elect Trump prepares to assume office.
  • DJI, a significant manufacturer, faces scrutiny and potential bans impacting its operations in the U.S.
"China accounts for the vast majority of U.S. commercial drone sales."

U.S. lawmakers express ongoing concerns about the national security implications of using Chinese drones.
newTitle: US Considers New Restrictions on Chinese Drones Amid Security Concerns

title: EXCLUSIVE: Maddock Films set for horror comedy universe with 8 films lined up from 2025 to 2028; Shakti Shalini & Chamunda are 2 new entrants - PINKVILLA
summary:
Maddock Films Announces Ambitious Horror Comedy Universe with 8 Films from 2025 to 2028

Publication Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: Pinkvilla

Maddock Films is set to expand its successful horror comedy genre with an ambitious slate of eight films planned from 2025 to 2028, introducing new titles like Thama, Shakti Shalini, and Chamunda.

  • Maddock Films will release two films each year from 2025 to 2028.
  • The new films will include titles like Thama (Diwali 2025) and Shakti Shalini (December 31, 2025).
  • Bhediya 2 and Chamunda will follow in 2026.
  • In 2027, Stree 3 and Mahamunjya are scheduled for release.
  • Grand culmination in 2028 with the epic two-part saga, Mahayudh.
“Our mission at Maddock has always been to innovate and entertain. We can’t wait to take audiences on this journey through 2028 and beyond.” – Dinesh Vijan

Maddock Films is poised to reshape the horror comedy genre in Indian Cinema with its interconnected universe of storytelling and compelling characters.

title: Hyundai Creta Electric With 473KM Claimed Range, Active Air Flaps Unveiled in India: Features, Launch Dat... - Gadgets 360
summary:
Hyundai Unveils Creta Electric in India With 473KM Claimed Range

Date: Not specified | Source: Gadgets 360

Hyundai has unveiled its Creta Electric in India, marking the company’s first localized electric SUV aimed at competing in the mid-size electric SUV market.

  • The Creta Electric will launch at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 from January 17-22.
  • It features includes connected LED lamps, active air flaps, and aero alloy wheels.
  • Available in four variants: Executive, Smart, Premium, and Excellence, with multiple color options.
  • It boasts two battery packs: 51.4 kWh (up to 473 km range) and 42 kWh (up to 390 km range).
  • Fast charging capabilities from 10% to 80% in 58 minutes using DC charging.
  • Offers cutting-edge technologies such as Vehicle-to-load (V2L) and i-Pedal.
"The long-range variant can accelerate from 0-100 km/h in 7.9 seconds."

The Hyundai Creta Electric aims to enhance the driving experience with a futuristic shift-by-wire system.
newTitle: Hyundai Unveils Creta Electric in India With 473KM Claimed Range

title: Blinkit launches 'ambulance in 10 minutes' service, Gurgaon first city to get instant transport - Hindustan Times
summary:
Blinkit launches 'ambulance in 10 minutes' service in Gurgaon

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Blinkit has introduced a service allowing Gurgaon residents to order ambulances within 10 minutes for emergencies.

  • First five ambulances operational in Gurugram starting today.
  • Ambulances equipped with essential life-saving equipment such as oxygen cylinders and defibrillators.
  • Each ambulance will have a trained paramedic, an assistant, and a driver.
  • Service aims to be affordable, with profits not a priority according to CEO Albinder Dhindsa.
  • Expansion planned for major cities over the next two years.
“Profit is not a goal for the newly launched service,” said Dhindsa.

This initiative aims to significantly improve emergency response times in cities.
newTitle: Blinkit launches 'ambulance in 10 minutes' service in Gurgaon

title: Prashant Kishor announces fast unto death over demand for BPSC exam cancellation - The Indian Express
summary:
Prashant Kishor announces fast unto death over BPSC prelims cancellation demand

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

In Patna, Jan Suraaj party founder Prashant Kishor announced a fast unto death to support BPSC aspirants demanding the cancellation of the prelims held last month.

  • Kishor alleges corruption in government job processes.
  • He has demanded fresh exams and action against corrupt officials.
  • Protesters claim issues like non-functional CCTV and late distribution of question papers existed during the exam.
  • Despite protests, the BPSC has only agreed to reschedule one center's exam.
“My demands include cancellation of the exam and holding of fresh tests. I also seek action against corrupt officials.” - Prashant Kishor

The protest highlights the ongoing issues surrounding government recruitment in Bihar and aims to draw attention to the plight of the students involved.

The National Students' Union of India (NSUI) has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to rename Delhi University's Veer Savarkar College in honor of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, emphasizing the need to recognize Singh's contributions to the nation.

  • NSUI believes renaming the college would be a fitting tribute to Singh's legacy.

Director Shankar’s upcoming film Game Changer, starring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, is set for theatrical release on January 10 for Sankranthi. The trailer showcases Ram in multiple roles, including an IAS officer, as a student, and a police officer.

  • The trailer was released at an event in Hyderabad attended by SS Rajamouli.
  • Ram Charan’s character faces a corrupt Chief Minister played by SJ Suryah.

Upasana Singh was the first choice for 'Maine Pyar Kiya' opposite Salman Khan: 'Kareena, Abhishek, Hrithi - TOI Etimes
summary:
Upasana Singh Reveals She Was First Choice for 'Maine Pyar Kiya' Opposite Salman Khan

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

In a recent interview, Upasana Singh disclosed that she was initially considered for the lead role opposite Salman Khan in the iconic film 'Maine Pyar Kiya'.

  • Upasana met with director Sooraj Barjatya and was told she was selected for the role.
  • She was ultimately not cast because she was taller than Salman Khan.
  • Producer Raj Kumar Barjatya confirmed she was the first choice during a gathering with Kareena Kapoor, Abhishek Bachchan, and Hrithik Roshan, leaving them shocked.
“He said, ‘did you know who was our first choice for Maine Pyar Kiya?’... It was Upasana.” - Upasana Singh

This revelation sheds light on the casting decisions behind a beloved film and highlights Upasana's impressive career thus far.
newTitle: Upasana Singh Reveals She Was First Choice for 'Maine Pyar Kiya' Opposite Salman Khan
